column1: J.R.R. Tolkiens concept of Faërie uses a deliberate variant spelling of fairy. While both spellings derive from Middle English faie ("possessing magical powers")
column2: the name fairy carries connotations of prettiness. Tolkien wanted to distance himself from this modern sense
column3: and by using Faërie (variants included Faery and Fayery) he sought "connotations older and considerably darker".
